did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Professional papers of Walter LaFeber, a Cornell University historian specializing in American foreign policy.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Walter LaFeber graduated from Hanover College in 1955, received a master's degree from Stanford University in 1956 and a Ph.D. from the University of Wisconsin in 1959. He came to Cornell in 1963 and is currently the Marie Underhill Noll Professor of American History. He specializes in American foreign policy. His major works include The New Empire: An Interpretation of American Expansion, America; Russia and the Cold War; and The Panama Canal: The Crisis in Historical Perspective; as well as editing John Q. Adams and the American Continental Empire.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Professional papers relating to his research, teaching, and writing about American foreign policy.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Closed for research for five years after the death of the donor and his spouse.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Walter LaFeber Papers, #14-17-2624. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
